speaker: LORD WILLOUGHBY
text_entry: SCENE II. The palace.

speaker: LORD WILLOUGHBY
text_entry: Enter QUEEN, BUSHY, and BAGOT

speaker: BUSHY
text_entry: Madam, your majesty is too much sad:

speaker: BUSHY
text_entry: You promised, when you parted with the king,

speaker: BUSHY
text_entry: To lay aside life-harming heaviness

speaker: BUSHY
text_entry: And entertain a cheerful disposition.

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: To please the king I did; to please myself

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: I cannot do it; yet I know no cause

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Why I should welcome such a guest as grief,

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Save bidding farewell to so sweet a guest

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: As my sweet Richard: yet again, methinks,

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Some unborn sorrow, ripe in fortune's womb,

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Is coming towards me, and my inward soul

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: With nothing trembles: at some thing it grieves,

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: More than with parting from my lord the king.

speaker: BUSHY
text_entry: Each substance of a grief hath twenty shadows,

speaker: BUSHY
text_entry: Which shows like grief itself, but is not so;

speaker: BUSHY
text_entry: For sorrow's eye, glazed with blinding tears,

speaker: BUSHY
text_entry: Divides one thing entire to many objects;

speaker: BUSHY
text_entry: Like perspectives, which rightly gazed upon

speaker: BUSHY
text_entry: Show nothing but confusion, eyed awry

speaker: BUSHY
text_entry: Distinguish form: so your sweet majesty,

speaker: BUSHY
text_entry: Looking awry upon your lord's departure,

speaker: BUSHY
text_entry: Find shapes of grief, more than himself, to wail;

speaker: BUSHY
text_entry: Which, look'd on as it is, is nought but shadows

speaker: BUSHY
text_entry: Of what it is not. Then, thrice-gracious queen,

speaker: BUSHY
text_entry: More than your lord's departure weep not: more's not seen;

speaker: BUSHY
text_entry: Or if it be, 'tis with false sorrow's eye,

speaker: BUSHY
text_entry: Which for things true weeps things imaginary.

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: It may be so; but yet my inward soul

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Persuades me it is otherwise: howe'er it be,

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: I cannot but be sad; so heavy sad

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: As, though on thinking on no thought I think,

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Makes me with heavy nothing faint and shrink.

speaker: BUSHY
text_entry: 'Tis nothing but conceit, my gracious lady.

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: 'Tis nothing less: conceit is still derived

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: From some forefather grief; mine is not so,

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: For nothing had begot my something grief;

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Or something hath the nothing that I grieve:

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: 'Tis in reversion that I do possess;

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: But what it is, that is not yet known; what

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: I cannot name; 'tis nameless woe, I wot.

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Enter GREEN

speaker: GREEN
text_entry: God save your majesty! and well met, gentlemen:

speaker: GREEN
text_entry: I hope the king is not yet shipp'd for Ireland.

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Why hopest thou so? 'tis better hope he is;

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: For his designs crave haste, his haste good hope:

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Then wherefore dost thou hope he is not shipp'd?

speaker: GREEN
text_entry: That he, our hope, might have retired his power,

speaker: GREEN
text_entry: And driven into despair an enemy's hope,

speaker: GREEN
text_entry: Who strongly hath set footing in this land:

speaker: GREEN
text_entry: The banish'd Bolingbroke repeals himself,

speaker: GREEN
text_entry: And with uplifted arms is safe arrived

speaker: GREEN
text_entry: At Ravenspurgh.

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Now God in heaven forbid!

speaker: GREEN
text_entry: Ah, madam, 'tis too true: and that is worse,

speaker: GREEN
text_entry: The Lord Northumberland, his son young Henry Percy,

speaker: GREEN
text_entry: The Lords of Ross, Beaumond, and Willoughby,

speaker: GREEN
text_entry: With all their powerful friends, are fled to him.

speaker: BUSHY
text_entry: Why have you not proclaim'd Northumberland

speaker: BUSHY
text_entry: And all the rest revolted faction traitors?

speaker: GREEN
text_entry: We have: whereupon the Earl of Worcester

speaker: GREEN
text_entry: Hath broke his staff, resign'd his stewardship,

speaker: GREEN
text_entry: And all the household servants fled with him

speaker: GREEN
text_entry: To Bolingbroke.

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: So, Green, thou art the midwife to my woe,

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: And Bolingbroke my sorrow's dismal heir:

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Now hath my soul brought forth her prodigy,

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: And I, a gasping new-deliver'd mother,

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Have woe to woe, sorrow to sorrow join'd.

speaker: BUSHY
text_entry: Despair not, madam.

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Who shall hinder me?

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: I will despair, and be at enmity

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: With cozening hope: he is a flatterer,

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: A parasite, a keeper back of death,

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Who gently would dissolve the bands of life,

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Which false hope lingers in extremity.

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Enter DUKE OF YORK

speaker: GREEN
text_entry: Here comes the Duke of York.

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: With signs of war about his aged neck:

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: O, full of careful business are his looks!

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Uncle, for God's sake, speak comfortable words.

speaker: DUKE OF YORK
text_entry: Should I do so, I should belie my thoughts:

speaker: DUKE OF YORK
text_entry: Comfort's in heaven; and we are on the earth,

speaker: DUKE OF YORK
text_entry: Where nothing lives but crosses, cares and grief.

speaker: DUKE OF YORK
text_entry: Your husband, he is gone to save far off,

speaker: DUKE OF YORK
text_entry: Whilst others come to make him lose at home:

speaker: DUKE OF YORK
text_entry: Here am I left to underprop his land,

speaker: DUKE OF YORK
text_entry: Who, weak with age, cannot support myself:

speaker: DUKE OF YORK
text_entry: Now comes the sick hour that his surfeit made;

speaker: DUKE OF YORK
text_entry: Now shall he try his friends that flatter'd him.

speaker: DUKE OF YORK
text_entry: Enter a Servant

speaker: Servant
text_entry: My lord, your son was gone before I came.

speaker: DUKE OF YORK
text_entry: He was? Why, so! go all which way it will!

speaker: DUKE OF YORK
text_entry: The nobles they are fled, the commons they are cold,

speaker: DUKE OF YORK
text_entry: And will, I fear, revolt on Hereford's side.

speaker: DUKE OF YORK
text_entry: Sirrah, get thee to Plashy, to my sister Gloucester;

speaker: DUKE OF YORK
text_entry: Bid her send me presently a thousand pound:

speaker: DUKE OF YORK
text_entry: Hold, take my ring.

speaker: Servant
text_entry: My lord, I had forgot to tell your lordship,

speaker: Servant
text_entry: To-day, as I came by, I called there;

speaker: Servant
text_entry: But I shall grieve you to report the rest.

speaker: DUKE OF YORK
text_entry: What is't, knave?

speaker: Servant
text_entry: An hour before I came, the duchess died.

speaker: DUKE OF YORK
text_entry: God for his mercy! what a tide of woes

speaker: DUKE OF YORK
text_entry: Comes rushing on this woeful land at once!

speaker: DUKE OF YORK
text_entry: I know not what to do: I would to God,

speaker: DUKE OF YORK
text_entry: So my untruth had not provoked him to it,

speaker: DUKE OF YORK
text_entry: The king had cut off my head with my brother's.

speaker: DUKE OF YORK
text_entry: What, are there no posts dispatch'd for Ireland?

speaker: DUKE OF YORK
text_entry: How shall we do for money for these wars?

speaker: DUKE OF YORK
text_entry: Come, sister,--cousin, I would say--pray, pardon me.

speaker: DUKE OF YORK
text_entry: Go, fellow, get thee home, provide some carts

speaker: DUKE OF YORK
text_entry: And bring away the armour that is there.

speaker: DUKE OF YORK
text_entry: Exit Servant

speaker: DUKE OF YORK
text_entry: Gentlemen, will you go muster men?

speaker: DUKE OF YORK
text_entry: If I know how or which way to order these affairs

speaker: DUKE OF YORK
text_entry: Thus thrust disorderly into my hands,

speaker: DUKE OF YORK
text_entry: Never believe me. Both are my kinsmen:

speaker: DUKE OF YORK
text_entry: The one is my sovereign, whom both my oath

speaker: DUKE OF YORK
text_entry: And duty bids defend; the other again

speaker: DUKE OF YORK
text_entry: Is my kinsman, whom the king hath wrong'd,

speaker: DUKE OF YORK
text_entry: Whom conscience and my kindred bids to right.

speaker: DUKE OF YORK
text_entry: Well, somewhat we must do. Come, cousin, I'll

speaker: DUKE OF YORK
text_entry: Dispose of you.

speaker: DUKE OF YORK
text_entry: Gentlemen, go, muster up your men,

speaker: DUKE OF YORK
text_entry: And meet me presently at Berkeley.

speaker: DUKE OF YORK
text_entry: I should to Plashy too;

speaker: DUKE OF YORK
text_entry: But time will not permit: all is uneven,

speaker: DUKE OF YORK
text_entry: And every thing is left at six and seven.

speaker: DUKE OF YORK
text_entry: Exeunt DUKE OF YORK and QUEEN

speaker: BUSHY
text_entry: The wind sits fair for news to go to Ireland,

speaker: BUSHY
text_entry: But none returns. For us to levy power

speaker: BUSHY
text_entry: Proportionable to the enemy

speaker: BUSHY
text_entry: Is all unpossible.

speaker: GREEN
text_entry: Besides, our nearness to the king in love

speaker: GREEN
text_entry: Is near the hate of those love not the king.

speaker: BAGOT
text_entry: And that's the wavering commons: for their love

speaker: BAGOT
text_entry: Lies in their purses, and whoso empties them

speaker: BAGOT
text_entry: By so much fills their hearts with deadly hate.

speaker: BUSHY
text_entry: Wherein the king stands generally condemn'd.

speaker: BAGOT
text_entry: If judgement lie in them, then so do we,

speaker: BAGOT
text_entry: Because we ever have been near the king.

speaker: GREEN
text_entry: Well, I will for refuge straight to Bristol castle:

speaker: GREEN
text_entry: The Earl of Wiltshire is already there.

speaker: BUSHY
text_entry: Thither will I with you; for little office

speaker: BUSHY
text_entry: The hateful commons will perform for us,

speaker: BUSHY
text_entry: Except like curs to tear us all to pieces.

speaker: BUSHY
text_entry: Will you go along with us?

speaker: BAGOT
text_entry: No; I will to Ireland to his majesty.

speaker: BAGOT
text_entry: Farewell: if heart's presages be not vain,

speaker: BAGOT
text_entry: We three here art that ne'er shall meet again.

speaker: BUSHY
text_entry: That's as York thrives to beat back Bolingbroke.

speaker: GREEN
text_entry: Alas, poor duke! the task he undertakes

speaker: GREEN
text_entry: Is numbering sands and drinking oceans dry:

speaker: GREEN
text_entry: Where one on his side fights, thousands will fly.

speaker: GREEN
text_entry: Farewell at once, for once, for all, and ever.

speaker: BUSHY
text_entry: Well, we may meet again.

speaker: BAGOT
text_entry: I fear me, never.

speaker: BAGOT
text_entry: Exeunt
